column1:
Lee_Fogel,"2017-05-20T04:49:42.42Z","Nice quality item but ho-hum parts","

I suggested
column2: this on LEGO.com for the 8 year old&nbsp
column5: thought it would be nice for her daughter to have. I know she likes the Friends theme.&nbsp
column6: It was on sale for $4.99 and looked like a smart buy.

column1: The quality of the paper and the spiral binding was better than I was expecting. The paper is a true notebook-style thickness while the binding was solid and anything but flimsy.
The book comes with 16 random pieces to use on
column2: the plate that is attached (or glued I assume) to the front cover. The choice
column3: of pieces is pretty under whelming in my opinion. The few flat plates included are neat but the other parts seem to be just a random mish&nbsp
column4: mash of shapes and a few flower heads. I looked&nbsp
column7: see if something could actually be built from it all. Consider me stumped. Having said that when my neighbor gave her 8 year old&nbsp
column8: daughter the notebook the young lady&nbsp

column1: Overall the rating is a 4 due to the excellent quality of the materials (and the few flat plate pieces). As a notebook it'
column2: s a nifty LEGO-themed item and a good value at $5.&nbsp
column3: But the pieces are a real disappointment.
